Paddy Chayevsky told the stewardess he wanted to sleep all during the trip not to wake him up but he woke up five minutes after the plane was in the air. John Travolta kept going to the bathroom coming out with his eyes bright red drinking orange juice and liquor in a paper cup and he put his head in a pillow and started crying. I saw him reading a script too so I thought he was acting. Really cute and sensitive-looking very tall comes off looking too fairy-ish like too many people around now but very good-looking. You can see the magic in him. I asked the stewardess why he was crying and she said "death in the family" so I thought it was a mother or father until I picked up the paper at home and found out that it was Diana Hyland who'd died of cancer at forty-one soap-opera queen his steady date. Dropped Fred and Todd Brassner (cab $27). Cab fares had gone up.

I am trying to figure out if these episodes of I Love Lucy where they go to Europe were done before or after Auntie Mame. They were about the same time I think but I wish I knew which was first. Oh the day before Julian Schnabel called and he was in the hospital where his wife just had a baby girl. And he was trying to sound excited. Because everybody really only wants a boy. He already has a girl (supplies $40). And oh I love my Enquirer gift subscription that someone gave me for Christmas. Everything they say is true. But I have to hide them-I am not allowed to have them in the house Jon does not like me to read them. Oh and I do not think I have said yet how odd it was to see Nelson Lyon's name in Time a couple of weeks ago. As if he were a real person! (laughs) Do you know what I mean? When they talk so importantly about someone you know it always looks so fake. Geraldine and I were talking about it. She said "Nelson will not even talk to anybody now that he is been in Time" he is going to be a key witness in the Belushi death trial-he was with Belushi and De Niro the night Belushi O.D. would.

Persons: [Barbara Allen, Cy Twombly, David Whitney, Sandro Chia]
Text: Christopher wanted to go out looking for ideas. It was a beautiful day. We went to Dubrow's the cafeteria this is in the garment center and they have all the red lights on the food so it all looks so good and everything is oversized and it is full of air. I thought it would be cheap but it was not ($20). Then we only had time to do the bottom floor of Macy's because Chris had an appointment. Talked to Jon he was entertaining Barbara Allen out in LA she is out there with John Samuels. Then there was a gallery opening at the Sperone Westwater Gallery for Cy Twombly. David Whitney and Sandro Chia and a couple of Italian artists were there. Then we went to Odeon. I was next to Si Newhouse who talked about the new Vanity Fair. He just bought a $800000 Jasper Johns. I told him I had some Warrens and Natalies that I would part with.

Persons: [Catherine Oxenberg, Jim Morrison, Princess Elisabeth, Sharon Hammond, Sylvester Stallone, Tom Baker]
Text: Catherine Oxenberg came for her cover Interview lunch at 1:00 and she is only eighteen so she was nervous and really blabbed everything about her mother sleeping around and how Sharon Hammond's sister Maureen was married to her father but how Maureen is now living with Catherine's half-brother who is maybe nineteen and she must be about forty I guess. Her mother's Princess Elisabeth of Yugoslavia. It was a Balducci's lunch it was a good interview. Tom Baker came to say goodbye he is leaving town. I told him about Sylvester Stallone wanting to play Jim Morrison and he said Stallone was too old to do it.

I cabbed down to Union Square and handed out Interviews (cab $4). And then I walked over to the office 1:00. Neil Sedaka arrived and he is just adorable he is great. We had Jane Forth there to do the makeup and little Emerson was with her. Neil posed and it was hard to get a good picture his face is so fat. We worked an hour on it.

Worked on the Michael Jackson Time cover until 8:00. Then watched some terrible TV. I saw Joan Collins in some old movie like Caesar and she was so bad and now she is got the right part and she is so good. It was all just finding the right part.

The front page of the Post said that Aly Kaiser was robbed of her jewels last night after she went home from the Liz Taylor party. I am so glad I did not talk jewelry with her like I was going to or I would be a suspect. But she only has the best the simplest and the best. It said the necklace was $500000. What I liked best in the article was that they called her "a divorcee." I have not seen that word in years. I wonder if maybe she was picking the guy up-I would not be surprised. Like that night when we all went to her house and the two Negro kids were with us-Esther Phillips and the guy she was with-she did not just have them because they were with us I think she had us because we were with them. But Paulette has to be careful-she is next because rubies are much more in demand now than diamonds. I want to invent a new kind of fast food and I was thinking what about a waffle thing that had the food on one side and the drink on the other-like ham and Coke? You could eat and drink at the same time.

Persons: [Barbara Allen, Caterine Milinaire, Dennis Hopper, Larry Rivers, Philip Niarchos, Princess Marina, Sidney Lumet, Tony Shafrazi]
Text: It was a pretty day walked around uptown then went to the office. Jamie and Arnold were there. I thanked them for a good time the night before (art supplies $5.85). Jamie said that Nureyev had fallen in love with Erskine and that Erskine had almost given in but did not and that Nureyev's last words (laughs) were "We can just watch TV." He gave autographs to Erskine and Catherine. Was picked up by Bob at 8 P.M. cabbed to the Iranian embassy. Bob made me go in black tie but we were the only formal ones and then his excuse was that we were invited to so many parties he did not remember. we are starting to feel used by the Iranians. It started in Washington a couple of weeks ago when we realized that Ambassador Zahedi is not "in" now with Carter-he was so Nixon- and Ford-affiliated but now he wants to be in with the Democrats and needs help and that is us. It was a heavy dinner for the Swedish ambassador. Our excuse for leaving early was that we had to go to Francois de Menil's party for Princess Marina of Greece who had an opening at the Iolas Gallery (cab to Francois's on 69th Street $2.25). It was jumping-Arman and Corice Larry Rivers-great party. Gigi was there and she just broke up with Ronnie and went off with Spyro Niarchos and so Ronnie was depressed. Earlier she would been telling me that it was on the rocks for her and Ronnie -she said they have not talked to each other for three months now. he is getting jealous of her making more money and traveling around but he is not ambitious and she is but she says she loves him but that they have to break up because it can not go on. that is the gist of it. Gigi had told me she was going to. Barbara Allen was there with Philip Niarchos they are back in town. Dennis Hopper was supposed to be there but I missed him. he is living with/staying with Caterine Milinaire-they are (laughs) "together." Ronnie's friend Tony Shafrazi was there just back from Iran. he is the one who defaced Picasso's painting at the Modern. The "Guernica." Hoveyda told us that Sidney Lumet is coming to Paulette's dinner at the embassy next week and we said "that is nice." I hear that Sidney Lumet goes around town calling me a racist just because Mandingo was my favorite movie of the year.

Jon called from California and said he would make it on time for the Bette Midler show and he did. At the end she did a serious thing where she broke down and thanked the kids who'd slept in line to get tickets. Jann Wenner was behind me and he said "What is Bob Colacello doing?" and then he tried to make it sound intriguing that he had lunch with him. I said "Why do not you hire him?" The show was over at 11:30 and I was home at 11:45. did not go to the Club A party for Bette.

Persons: [Doug Wick, Jamie Wyeth, Jean Kennedy Smith, Jean Michel Basquiat, Lacey Neuhaus, Marina Schiano, Nan Kempner, Perry Ellis, Stephen Sprouse, Ted Kennedy, Teri Toye]
Text: Got up early. Benjamin picked me up and we went to the Calvin Klein fashion show. We were late but they would saved my seat up front (cab $6). Nan Kempner did not say hello probably because she did not invite me to her dinner that night for Jamie Wyeth I guess she was embarrassed. But maybe it was my fault because when you are late you rush in and you do not know who to look at first because everybody's there so you are awkward. And Calvin's stuff was like Perry Ellis with touches of YSL. I guess Marina Schiano puts in her two cents. The colors were all somber. Blacks and greys. It was a beautiful day and I wanted to get out of the office but never did. Jean Michel Basquiat came by and we worked. Went to the Coe Kerr Gallery for the Jamie Wyeth opening. Ran into Lacey Neuhaus and Doug Wick and talked to Ted Kennedy Jr. Jean Kennedy Smith was there and she was nice and smiling. Jamie invited me down to the farm this weekend but I said I had to be packing and moving. Cabbed to the Ritz ($4) with Jon we went in to see the Stephen Sprouse fashion show. It was early but it was mobbed already. My seat was gone so I took Charivari's. Teri Toye the transvestite was in the show. And everybody was saying it was like the sixties. The show was great really the fashion is so good again with these disco kids they have a real look. Like the boys with the straight cut over one eye. So extreme now.

Karen the almost-doctor came by and I think I will become her first patient when she gets her office in three months. I am thinking of a facelift but she said to wait and she would give it to me. I never went back to Dr. Rees after that consultation I still owe him $200. Then Steve Aronson came in with a girl named Evgenia she is a Guinness but she has a Polish last name and she is Robert Lowell's stepdaughter-a short dark-haired English girl she is trying to be a model. And we all went to Worth Street just near Canal and I let the girl pay for the cab. Somehow I did not want to somehow I wanted her to. The three of us were being photographed together I did not know why for the English magazine Ritz which I hear David Bailey's sold but it is still hanging on. Somebody was getting something but I could not figure out what was going on. And you could tell the photographer was an amateur because he took too many pictures too many rolls. Left there. Dropped Steve off ($5.50) and then I finally put it together what it was all about. The girl wanted pictures to use in her modeling portfolio and the Ritz wanted pictures of me so she used Steve to get me down there by telling him they needed me to represent (laughs) "hype" because they are running an interview with Steve on his book Hype. In the cab Steve said the picture they took of the three of us was going to be on the cover and so then I just looked at him-I mean if it is for the cover they will just crop him out anyway and they will use a picture of me and say "Mr. Hype." So that was a real waste of time for everybody but the girl.

Got up early did the phones. Had an appointment with Doc Cox walked up there. The receptionist lit into me about how I did not pay my bills on time and how Vincent was so awful when she called and I was starting to tell her off but then I stopped. And Doc Cox could hear everything so I guess he was the one who told her to say those things. And Rosemary is still the big cheese over there. I had an 11:00 appointment but I did not get out until 1:00 or 1:30. The New York Times had a big article about gay cancer and how they do not know what to do with it. That it is epidemic proportions and they say that these kids who have sex all the time have it in their semen and they have already had every kind of disease there is-hepatitis one two and three and mononucleosis and I am worried that I could get it by drinking out of the same glass or just being around these kids who go to the Baths.

Got up at 7:30 and called Chris Makos to discuss the evening before with Jon Gould. I have offered Chris a reward-this one gold watch he wants-if he can talk Jon into doing something with me but even if nothing romantic happens now I still want Jon to move in because then we would see what happens from there. I had a 10:00 appointment with Doc Cox and I decided to get exercise and walk to his office but it was not a good idea I was overwalked and tired by the time I got there. And the Doc did not really care about me. His hair was dyed and he was pudgy and he just wanted to hear gossip. He gave me some salve and then he said I had to get polio tetanus and pneumonia shots and I did not want to I said I would do it some other day but Rosemary grabbed me on the way out and gave them all to me and she said I would not have reactions but I felt funny all day.

Persons: [Britt Ekland, Jean Michel Basquiat, Kenny Scharf, Ming Vauze, Stephen Sprouse, Steve Rubell]
Text: The day of the opening night of the Palladium. The day started off with the problem of Amos being sick. And then the guy painting the roof across the street came over and said mine needed doing. He got my name from the super over there I guess and I gave him the go-ahead to do it and he did it. Then he gave me a bill for $4900. I had not remembered to get an estimate. My fault. Then I get a note from the neighbor saying my roof is now silver and that they just can not stand looking at it. they are telling the right guy right? No silver. Anyway I told him to repaint it and I asked him how much that would be and he says it will take thirty gallons to spray it and it will cost $1200. And he does it in five minutes. Five minutes! I thought it would take hours. And then later he says $1500 and I reminded him that he would said $1200 before. So in the midst of all those problems Benjamin picked me up early and we cabbed to the office ($4) and the place is so big and spread-out I ran up and down stairs up and down and sideways up and down and sideways. that is my life there. that is what I do for a living since we moved there. Keith showed up. We were waiting for Kenny Scharf to call to say if he wanted to go to Stephen Sprouse's to get an outfit but then he went on his own. He got pink Stephen Sprouse low-riders and wore them with a blouse made by his wife Teresa. But I do not think it is attractive seeing the crack in the ass. On girls either. I do not like it really. Then we picked up PH and went down with Keith to the Palladium and went in the back door on 13th Street and the electricians and construction people were working fast. We went up to Steve Rubell's office and the phones were ringing and he was saying "there is no door list the invitations all were delivered yesterday and there is no list." And in between people were coming in with the list. Then I left after taping some more for the Party book and taking some pictures. Dropped PH ($5). Went home and glued. Picked Cornelia up and she looked beautiful she got this idea to wear a long braid and she looked like Britt Ekland or something (cab $6). And Halston came out for this that was a big thing. So anyway we went in and stood in a couple of places. And Benjamin was there as Ming Vauze in a grape-colored strapless with a tulle skirt. And Beauregard who writes for Details was in drag too. Boy George was there with Marilyn who is always obnoxious she had a camera. Eric and Shawn from Area were there looking glum. Chris in a striped outfit was there he was complaining that the drinks were not free but Cornelia was getting the Cristal from Dan Steve's driver from New Hampshire who is now the "general manager" there but I do not think that is going to work out because he is too nice he will never be the type to manage a place. And Jean Michel Basquiat was in a dark mood. he would bought Jennifer a dress to wear to the opening and then he did not even bring her he left her home. And I did not lecture him about the heroin he takes because I did not want to have a fight. And I am worried about Ming turning into an alcoholic because I saw what happened with Curley-it starts very happy and lots of fun but it does not end up that way. And the Palladium I do not know it was good for opening night but they are going to have to have the bridge and tunnel people in there all the time to fill it up. And if it is a success then we will know there is no recession. And the funny thing about putting art in a disco is that in the end when you pack all the people in it does not make a bit of difference. It really does not. You do not even see things. And like that Saturday Night Fever "discotheque room" they have-when it filled up you could not even see what it was supposed to be it is just all bodies dancing and you do not notice what anything is. So Steve Rubell really has a story now jail and then the Big Comeback. "I never lost faith" he says. But he lost hair. Left at 2:30.

Cab to the Olympic Tower ($3.25). Halston had designed uniforms for the Girl Scout troop leaders. So many ladies pounced on me. I said that Halston must be making a bundle on this but it turned out he did it all for free. it is a great way for these ladies to get a Halston for cheap-pants are only $25. He did them in a funny color green-it is not my favorite green-but then all the ladies wearing it did look pretty. Then we had to leave we were going to the tenth New York magazine anniversary party at Citicorp Center that the editor Joe Armstrong had called and invited us to. It was jammed. Joe Armstrong met us he said they would just had a fire in that big furniture store on the ground floor there. Bella Abzug was there she said she was on a diet but she was tasting everything that came her way. The owners of Plato's Retreat came over and invited us both to Plato's. The man said "Come and just hang out for an hour or so have a drink." And the girl said "The vibrations are so beautiful you will not believe the things you will see." So I said "Come on Bella. we are a couple -what are we waiting for?" And Bella called her husband over and said "Martin Andy just invited me to Plato's." And Martin said something like "Go ahead Bella. Enjoy!" But Bella said she did not think it would look good in the papers.

I tried to get some background information on Steven Spielberg for the interview with him. I decided not to be mad at the horrible P.R. girl who would not let me into the screening of E.T. the other night. She sent orchids to apologize and it is stupid to keep thinking about things like that.

My day started off with destruction. I picked up this rug and the moths had eaten it right through. they are all in the back. I am going to spread more moth stuff. So far they only got an Indian rug but they could eventually get to my Stephen Sprouse things. Benjamin came and we decided to walk down Madison to the office. We did not have any Interviews. Rupert arrived at 6:30 and worked a little. His boyfriend picked him up in Rupert's Rolls Royce he was out there waiting like a nagging wife I guess Rupert wants that though. Poor Rupert is henpecked. And I am just waiting for them to have the big fight. The guy is taking him for a ride. So there he was waiting in this grand left-side-driving Rolls. And they gave me a ride home because it was raining and hard to get a cab. And during the day I bought lots of newspapers for the front pages-they had the sextuplets on ($2). And People magazine has the article on the artists and it has "Andy Warhol fifty-eight." And then "Keith Haring twenty-two." So if anybody asks just tell them I am eighty. Always "he is eighty."

Persons: [Anton Perrich, Doc Cox, Jean Michel Basquiat, Keith Haring, Ray Johnson, Stuart Pivar, Tony Shafrazi, Virginia Dwan]
Text: Benjamin called in the morning and we dished on the phone for a while and then he came up. I called the elevator man and told him about a spark I saw but he said the spark's always there that it happens all the time. Then since I had to go to the Doc's at 3:00 I could not eat because I was going to have tests. But we wandered around and I had a lot of energy because of the vitamins. Jean Michel Basquiat came down to the office early. He was reading his big review in the Voice. They called him the most promising artist on the scene. And at least they did not mention me and say he should not be hanging around with me the way the New York Times thing did. I opened up one of the boxes in the back that is being moved and it had 16mm rolls of film and letters from Ray Johnson the artist and I think my bloodstained clothes from when I was shot. I realized that the reason Tony Shafrazi has not gotten even one of the artists in his gallery into MOMA is because Tony's the person who defaced Picasso's "Guernica." But that is not fair. Keith Haring is not at MOMA. And they just have one thing of mine the little Marilyn. I just hate that. That bothers me. Then in the afternoon I went to Doc Cox's (cab $7) and I protested over the thermometer that they used because it just sits there in water and everybody uses it it is not right. And Rosemary took my blood pressure but I have the feeling they just throw these tests out. Bubbles was tan. And they have a new heart machine so now I do not have to run up and down the stairs in the hallway (laughs) to get my heart going-it is a big improvement. And Freddy will not take your blood if she does not know you. We went to meet Paige and Benjamin ($4). And after dinner ($120) at Hisae and drinks at Jezebel's ($30) we went over to Stuart Pivar's because he was having people over and I wanted to learn about art. I brought a small bronze with me that I just bought three inches and Stuart said it was a piece of junk so tomorrow I am returning it. I had it on consignment. And did I tell the Diary that Benjamin and I ran into Virginia Dwan and her daughter who is married to Anton Perrich who did all those videos and rented our old floor at 33 Union Square West when we moved out. They said Anton was home with his painting machine and I was so jealous. My dream. To have a machine that could paint while you are away. But they said he had to be there while it painted because (laughs) it clogs up. is not that funny?

Persons: [Alex Liberman, Annette Reed, Bill Blass, Carolina Herrera, Cecile Zilkha, Cliff Robertson, Dina Merrill, Doria Reagan, Jane Holzer, Pat Buckley, Sophie Englehard]
Text: Doria Reagan was typing letters for Bob and I did not even recognize her I was walking by. She was in a T-shirt and shorts and she looked cute. I invited her in for the lunch but she said she had too much work to do she is working four hours a day-she gets things done very quickly. I went over to 927 Fifth Avenue to the Zilkhas' dinner for the people who own Dior. It was sweet of Cecile Zilkha to invite me because it was really a heavy-duty dinner. Happy Rockefeller was happy to see me. I should have talked to her a lot. Annette Reed had a fifty-carat sapphire on a diamond necklace that was about two inches wide. She was dressed beautifully. she is a sister of the Sophie Englehard girl who is Jane Holzer's friend the one who is with the black football player who I met in Washington. The ladies were all statuesque. Dina Merrill was with her husband Cliff Robertson. Alex Liberman was there with his wife Tatiana. Carolina Herrera was there and I would brought the new issue of Interview and she stole it because her picture was in it. All the fairies were there. And it was old-fashioned kind of living. If this style of living goes on it will be incredible. How can it last? The first course was crab meat in tomato aspic and you do not see things like that anymore. And then the chicken with fresh cranberries and rice with nuts and chocolate mousse with hard crumbled cake and good wine all served so beautifully. And flower arrangements up to the ceiling. Bill Blass was there and Pat Buckley in Bill Blass. But everybody looked so old. But then I guess I fit in. But it is funny they would think to invite me. I am looking very good now I could have any of these old bags. I should go after Yoko Ono but I would probably do it at the wrong time-just when she would just found somebody I would call her. I got home to no phone call from California.
Lewis Allen came by and he wants to do the play Evening with Andy Warhol with a dummy of me on stage saying dialogue based on the Philosophy book and Exposures.

Persons: [Diana Vreeland, Jane Holzer, Martha Graham, Swan Lake, Thomas Ammann]
Text: Fred's going to Europe on Friday to the big Thurn und Taxis thing. I am not going-he does not want to take care of me. Worked until 6:45 and then all the dishes from the lunch were still in the kitchen and I told Fred that the kitchen was dirty and he looked at me and said "Well I am not going to do the dishes." Diana Vreeland has been really a bad influence on him. I should have broken that up. In the old days Fred would have been the first person to roll up his sleeves and start scrubbing. I had already called for a car so I just had time to clean the coffeepot and I guess Jay cleaned up the rest. Jay's in a good mood lately. Maybe he has a new girlfriend. Thomas Ammann saw Jay's art and loved it but that was a one-time painting-he is not painting like that now. The young artists are all now doing abstract paintings because they are making fun of that now. they are going through everything making fun of every period. Went to see Martha Graham with Jane Holzer and Halston. Halston did the costumes. They did ballets from like 1906 and 1930 and it was funny to see what dancers were like then-they were like hoochy-koochy girls. (laughs) Ballet needs a new defector-you watch these Russian dancers and we do not have anything like that here. I was watching a Russian group do "Swan Lake" and it was just such a difference.

Benjamin and I wandered and went into a Japanese restaurant and called John Reinhold to meet us but then they said they would not give us a table until he came. Then when he came they said they did not have a table and we got mad and left in a huff and we were going to go to Pearl's but then we went to Raga and we go in and there is a "hostess" who thinks she is so grand and there is absolutely nobody in the place-eighteen empty tables and she is putting on these grand airs like a drag queen or something floating around with these sleeves. And she takes a phone call and has us stand there waiting as if the phone call is more important. So we ate and it was really expensive for just what was going to be a run-in-quick lunch ($125 and I did not tip much either). "Yes we may have a table for you...."I mean what are these people thinking about? Left there cabbed to meet Lidija ($6). Jean Michel Basquiat was there he would gotten pizza but then did not want it. Then we painted an African masterpiece together. One hundred feet long. he is better than I am though. Worked till 6:30.

I called Doc Cox and wanted to ask about the gallbladder medicine but he was not there I guess he is too busy with his garden party. Francois de Menil called and invited Fred and me for dinner but then later on he called and said he had to make it for just drinks. he is just back from Hollywood where he signed a deal with a woman named Hannah Weinstein to produce four movies and so we were going to talk movie-talk with him (cab $4). Francois looked heavier and happier. He told us his mother was starting a museum that she was giving $5 million. God it is so incredible to have that much money it is so abstract. You just sit there and try to think of how to be creative with it. We stayed there until 8:30. I began watching The Valachi Papers on TV with Charles Bronson and then I fell asleep and then I woke up and ran to the window when I heard a voice say "Open up it is the narcotics squad" and then I realized it was on the TV. It was scary to think that when you dream you are dreaming what is on TV and it is so real. I really thought the narcotics squad was right there.

Persons: [Barbara Allen, Daniel Templon, Florence Van, Manuela Papatakis, Philip Niarchos, Princess Grace, Sao Schlumberger]
Text: -Paris Cabbed to Plaza-Athenee ($ 5) to meet Bianca to interview Ungaro. Bianca had a small but beautiful suite with a terrace facing the courtyard filled with geraniums and red umbrellas. Read an English newspaper. Ate an orange that was there while we waited. She was looking all over for her Faberge amethyst and when she could not find it she said she could not do the interview with us and she ran out to Castel's to crawl on her hands and knees looking for it-she thought she lost it there the night before. Bettina was the first to arrive for lunch so we interviewed her. She works for Ungaro now. She was wearing a Bulgari snake watch and white Ungaro suit. Then Ungaro finally arrived. He was wearing a white suit too. Then went to his place. Princess Grace and Caroline of Monaco ran out of Ungaro Couture when they heard we were next door at Ungaro Homme. Bob bought a suit. Then we went to the Rue Beaubourg for my Hammer & Sickle opening at the Galerie Daniel Templon. All the same punks were there plus Sao Schlumberger in a blue Givenchy. She was on her way to Florence Van der Kemp's dinner in Versailles. Barbara Allen came early and told us all her own gossip-she and Philip Niarchos had a big fight last night. He accused her of having affairs with Jack Warren and Mick. She did not deny it even though she says she has not. He admitted to her his affair with Manuela Papatakis in the south of France plus one other plus three hookers. In three weeks. They made a pact that when they are together they are "together" but when they are not they are "not." Some punks had a fight and a tooth got knocked out. They started screaming my name loudly so I was locked into the office. Then it was time to leave for dinner. On the way out a drunk creep kissed me smack on the lips and I almost fainted. Oh and Bianca was in a great mood because they would found her amethyst. She had threatened to bring in private detectives. So they questioned the help-they have all worked there for years- and the oldest man was the one who'd found it when he cleaned up and kept it.

Fred told me that as he was going by 63rd Street and Park he saw these two guys hugging and kissing in the middle of the street and it turned out to be Victor and his boyfriend so I guess I do not have to worry about Victor for a while again.

Persons: [Chris Makos, Jackie Curtis, Jay Shriver, Peter Wise]
Text: Vincent hired some security. He did not want me to come to the office but I had work to do. Peter Wise told me that I should get a bulletproof vest that he knew where you could get them. I was a chatterbox because I was nervous. Went down to 11th and University Place to a funny shop on the second floor (cab $6). Peter had called Christopher to meet me there and take photographs. I bought a bulletproof vest ($270). The guy was really creepy he said his business had really soared after the Reagan thing. He had dresses and coats and everything bulletproof and there was a sports jacket I asked him to hold for me that I would come back and pick up and it seems really warm for winter too. We asked him what else he had and he said he would not say in front of the media because a journalist from Stern came there with us so Christopher can not wait to go back there to see what he is got that he would not say. Then Christopher had his bike downstairs but I could not even get on it with my backpack. I called Jay Shriver at the office and he came to meet me around the back of the building. Went up in the freight elevator. Then it was the busiest day ever. The cop we rented could not believe all the freaks we have up there. And there is always some new girl at Interview who will buzz anybody in. I called Jon at Paramount he was in meetings. Bob did not come down to the office. Brigid's jealous because I have lost all this weight but she looks better with her face filled in a little. She got rid of her cat Billy because he was sick with a virus so she is heartless and cruel. I told her "you are no good." And she just says she does not want to talk about it she is waiting for a new cat to come in at the store. Jackie Curtis came up and she just has dyed hair but short. he would been to Gstaad and had a really handsome boyfriend with her I do not know how she does it and she is fat and smelled of liquor and she was limping so it was really pathetic. She brought me a shopping bag. [Note: when Andy talked about men who wore women's clothes or makeup he would randomly refer to them as "he" or "she."] Oh and that guy at that shop said he made a bulletproof raincoat for the pope. And disguises do not seem to work for me-I am going to get a fisherman's hat tomorrow. I think that is the best like Mr. Winters used to wear. Picked up Jon on the corner of 18th between Eighth and Ninth and we went to Chris Makos's on Waverly Place (cab $9). Found a Citibank machine and Jon used it and I have never done one before and it is so exciting it asks you questions.

Persons: [Della Femina, Jerry Della Femin, Jerry Zipkin, John Fairchild, Perry Ellis]
Text: Wilfredo picked me up and we went over to Calvin Klein's on 38th and Broadway which seemed like a firetrap you wait for the elevator for hours. John Fairchild was twenty minutes late and they held the show for him. It was great to read in Page Six that Jerry Della Femina's ad agency did a Perry Ellis ad and the boy model was reading a book and there was the word "fuck" and Fairchild would not run it in WWD and Della Femina said something like "Who does John Fairchild think he is? He may be able to push Jerry Zipkin and all the other walkers around but not the ad agencies." So that was kind of great hearing Fairchild get told off. I thought the show was like mild Halston with the sweaters tied around the shoulders and things like that coats and hats and pants and all lengths but Fred said it was "Rich Wasp." Tried to get work done (cab $4). Bruno had left candy for me and it was all I could think about sitting there so I ate it and it gave me energy. Rupert came up and he still has the same cough but he said his psychiatrist says it is just a way of hanging on to the boyfriend who died.

Fred called from Europe and said he was coming in today. Jean Michel Basquiat said he decided not to do anything for Steve Rubell's new club because he asked what he was going to get out of it and Steve told him "it is for the glory the prestige." Can you imagine hearing this from Steve? I am still trying to get the drink tickets I am designing for him together so I will ask about which day PH and I can tape him for the Party book as soon as I give them to him so he will feel guilty.

Persons: [Jean Michel Basquiat, Paul Anka, Peter Gidal]
Text: Went to pick up Benjamin and we took Interviews and went over to Christie's and the girl there was nice she showed us the show. And there is a big fake of mine there but I would signed it. I do not know why I ever did. But it was Peter Gidal's and he would done that book on me so I wanted to be nice once and I would signed it for him. it is four Jackies and I never put them together in a print I do not think. No my Jackies were all separate. And then we left there and passed Regine's and Benjamin nudged me because Paul Anka was saying hello and I did not recognize him. he is so suntanned. And Benjamin knew I did his portrait so he poked me. I just saw clips of him when he was young on TV this morning. He looks a lot better now than he did then-he must have had a lot done. Jean Michel Basquiat came up and was so paranoid he smokes so much marijuana and then gets paranoid. Then he called me up in the middle of the night and said that his painting at auction went for $19000. I bet mine went for nothing. Probably. My Liz. Probably $10000. I can just see it. So his went for $19000. And there were all these parties for the Museum of Modern Art and I was invited to all of them but I did not go to any of them. Dropped Benjamin ($6.50). Woods for dinner with Jon ($100).

Persons: [Aldo Moro, Chris Makos, David Bowie, Doc Cox, Larry Rivers, Vladimir Horowitz]
Text: I called Bianca and the guy that answered gave me a funny answer so I did not know if she was standing there. Then she finally called back and said that David Bowie was busy and could not have lunch but that we should do it tomorrow. So I guess she was not mad. And Chris Makos called about the interview with the psychiatrist who is doing a book on famous people's IQs and he wants to give me the IQ test but I have decided I am not going to take it. I mean why should I let anyone know how stupid I am. And the release this guy sent was too much-it practically said he would own my brain cells. So now Chris is mad at me for backing out. And have I said that I met a boy at Studio 54 who told me that he had an affair with Vladimir Horowitz? I said "How could a seventy-nine-year-old man get it up?" I just do not believe it. And Doc Cox called for me he is been calling for a couple of months saying he is giving a party for me and asking for my list of people and then suddenly he said "Do you mind if it is also a party for Larry Rivers?" is not that odd? Does that mean he is mad at me? Larry's out of the hospital he would had heart palpitations again. And today they found Aldo Moro's body dead in Italy.

Actually slept through PH's call. Woke up at noon when Jed came in to shake me. The nightlife is taking its toll. Kevin Goodspeed called from San Francisco. There were about fifteen really important calls that I never called back. Lucie and Desi Arnaz Jr. called-I would seen them at a party the other night-and I have not returned their call yet. I dropped Catherine (cab $4). I think she is having a secret affair because she is always busy now.

Cabbed to meet Lidija ($6). A German kid was at 860 and said he would been to that bar Cowboys the night before and that the AIDS scare is over that "the mood is back." And Robert Hayes's boyfriend who has it is in town staying with him. They can not give him chemotherapy because something else happens when they do. And now Jean Michel Basquiat has this blonde WASP girl that he is fucking. I think he hates all white women. And Cornelia's taken my scarf. She always goes out with no clothes on and see-through dresses and then she complains she is too cold. So she took the great red scarf that I got at a fashion show so that is the end of that. And it was finally the right red.

Truman Capote stopped by he was visiting Bob MacBride in his studio at 33 Union Square. Truman may be on Lithium because suddenly he is happy. But my real theory is that he went out to Long Island and saw Jack Dunphy and that Jack Dunphy finally agreed to write Answered Prayers for him. And he had the most chic coat on. Courreges. One big zipper and two zippers for the pockets. He said it was a few years old. But his hands are cold. Which drug is that? I worked at the office until 7:30. Rupert was helping me try to paint with a brush the piss on the brush but it was hard. Dropped Rupert ($4). Ann Lambton's in town. she is about to go cross-country visiting the Americans she is met in London the past couple of years. it is incredible what a figure she has now.

I was invited to lunch at the Met so I stayed uptown. All the people there were so classy and elegant and smart and when I tried to say little comments they would not listen to me. They were rich and young and glamorous and English. Had a martini with a little vodka. I needed it for courage because the people were so highfalutin'. Prince and Princess Michael of Kent arrived and they were really classy. She had on a little hat and a big dress and she explained that she was pregnant-she was friendly to me. She showed me a picture of her eighteen-month-old baby. The prince had on a well-cut suit-the English know how to give you a new body with a suit putting the stuff in all the right places. Left there and went down to work. I would asked John Reinhold to be my dinner date so he picked me up (cab $5). Downstairs at the Italian Pavilion. Joe MacDonald was trying to slip out because he said he had "a fuck date." We finished dinner at 12:00 (cab $4.50). After I got home John called and said his wife was not home that this was the first time that would ever happened. I did not know what to say I would already taken a Valium and did not know what to do.

Stuart was picking me up at my house so I waited for him inside the door. And now we have a video camera to see outside and I could see a man trying to get in the door with keys and everything and it looked just like Stuart somehow. It had his attitude. But then it was not Stuart and he was still trying to use a key to get in. I decided to open the door and see who he was and so I did and I think he was drunk or something. He asked for the lady of the house a few times and I kept telling him that I was the lady of the house. And then I went back inside and the phone rang and it was Stuart to tell me that there was a man on my doorstep trying to get in and I told him I knew and then Stuart came to pick me up again and I went out to the car and past the man who was still there and I got into the limo and Stuart was crying. Literally crying. The tears were streaming down his face. It was shocking just absolutely shocking. I said "It was so odd I thought he was you at first." And Stuart was sobbing saying what if it were him and how could I just leave him there? And I said "Well I think he is drunk and what can I do anyway?" So he said to take him somewhere put him in a cab and get him where he was going but how could you know where he was going? So I borrowed $20 from Stuart and gave it to a cabdriver to take him where he was going but he probably just dumped him in another neighborhood. But he was well-dressed. Like a Spanish man in cream-colored Spanish boots and kind of natty. By the way Michael Jackson never did show up he called and cancelled right before he was supposed to be there.

We went to the perfume department at Bloomingdale's and this old lady next to me kept saying "I am standing next to him. I never dreamed it would happen. I am standing next to him." And I did not even have an Interview left to give her I would given them all out. We left and I told Benjamin I would had my fame fix for the day. We went to 47th Street and got hustled into some silver junk. Benjamin got a piece himself actually-it is only the second time that is happened. He saw it and wanted it first. I should have gotten it for him but it was too awkward. I remember when I was with John Lennon and he was buying thousands of dollars' worth of clothes and did not say "Do you want a shirt?" Years ago. And I have found more Polaroids of him and Yoko Ono only I did that thing that Brigid did I glued them onto wood and they wrinkled. Vincent just called and said there is a picture of me-of the robot-in People. The dummy that is going to star in the Evening with Andy Warhol. they are getting an awful lot of mileage out of nothing yet.

Persons: [Barbara Allen, Barbra Streisand, Cy Twombly, Taki Theodoracopulos, Thomas Ammann]
Text: Thomas Ammann had called and invited me to dinner with Cy Twombly. And then Bob got invited. Thomas asked me where we should go. I told him about the Palace-that restaurant on 59th Street in the Sovereign that is been in the papers for a year or so that is supposed to be so expensive-I told him it was $300 per person and he laughed and said it could not be that much that that was fine and that is where we would go. And then Thomas called Barbara Allen and she was with Taki Theodoracopulos so they came. The Palace had a crocheted curtain in the window it looked like a place that gave palm readings. We were the only ones in the place but there were about eighteen people running around to serve. The look was like going to the tackiest person's apartment who is trying to put on the dog. Like going to Barbra Streisand's house. West Side taste. Every table was under a chandelier and the dishes had gold trim on them that kind of thing. But the food was good. There were eight courses. The bill came to $914 and I think it shocked Thomas. I really think he was really shocked. Because after he saw the bill he stopped making fun of the meal.

Vincent was going away and so we stayed late and paid bills and Jay was in a mood where he wanted to get screamed at. When he wants to get screamed at he does something wrong on purpose. Like he painted something the wrong color and he said he knew he did it. After he gets screamed at he just looks like nothing happened but he is satisfied. And we were there till late. I am invited to Halston's for Thanksgiving dinner.

Persons: [Frank O'Hara, John Bernard Myers, Lady Sharon, Larry Rivers]
Text: Got to my exercise appointment at Lady Sharon's by 9:50 and had a good time did a whole hour. The trainer Lidija was wearing Revlon Moondrops lipstick pink and Chris had been telling me that my lips are too pale so I went to Bloomingdale's right after paying her ($30) and got some lipstick ($3.75). I worked painted for a while and then after Vincent had had time to set up went over to Larry Rivers's where Vincent was videotaping (cab $5). And Larry gave a good interview. It was weird he said he had his eyes lifted and that he would had a scar removed and I just could not believe it I said "Well then why did not you get your nose done?" And he said because it would have changed his character! And Larry was talking about getting old and I told him to just not think that way. He said he had to sleep with John Bernard Myers to get shown in his gallery and gee he is done so much he was Frank O'Hara's boyfriend too. Larry gave us a good video interview but now I have to do one for him in return. Larry's strange he is sort of a good artist but such a nutty person. Then decided to have Thanksgiving dinner at home two days early because all my friends are leaving town on Thanksgiving day. I told Jon and Christopher and Peter to come at 8:00. Peter makes the best pies. And we played Christmas tapes and we overate. And then we went upstairs and Chris pushed the furniture around and we played Charades. And then around 10:30 we decided to go to Studio 54 for Bob's party for Sao and we found a parking space and got there before Bob and Sao and I went on the dance floor and danced every dance and the reason I have now just begun to dance is because I finally realized that nobody really notices you. I mean I watched Jon go out there and jump and bounce and I thought Well I can do that too. it is one thing I have picked up from him I might as well get something out of it. So now I will be dancing. And then I heard that Jed was there so I guess he saw me dancing. He could have gotten me dancing all those years that is something he could have done for me. And I was not drunk at all either. I was just miserable because things do not turn out like you expect them to I was in sort of a horrible mood. I had a sip of champagne that is all. And then I danced with Gaetana and with Sao and with PH and I just never knew I could do it before.

Mike the super came up and said that there would not be heat over the holiday weekend. That was a big disappointment because that is when I was planning to get all my work done that is why I was staying in town. The Reagan kid cancelled dinner like I told Bob he would. Then it was in the papers that the Reagans were honeymooning with the Warhol crowd at Le Cirque.

The second day of the auctions at Sotheby's-Renaissance. Was picked up by Benjamin. Stuart arrived late and looked like Dracula. We lost out on everything which was fun-it was all learning and seeing and touching and feeling and it did not cost a penny. Left there and walked for a while. Oh and Stuart told me I am the only one who talks to all the black guys who work at the auction houses asking them what they think of the things (laughs) Went back to the office and worked from 6-9:00 and everybody else was working late too. Fred's walking with a cane. Then invited Paige and Rupert to Nippon. it is nice not to have Sam to worry about anymore. Since I found out he has a secret life and sleeps out a lot I do not feel responsible for him.

The New York Times had a big story on AIDS. The tourist business in Haiti is down to nothing. Probably the tourists were only there secretly for the big cocks. Because Jean Michel Basquiat is half Haitian and he really does have the biggest one. Went to the Trump Tower and laid out a stack of Interviews and watched people take them for free. A lady was shaking when she asked me for an autograph and she said "God bless you" and I hope she is right. I heard that Peter Brant just bought Antiques magazine I guess for Sandy to run. it is a good idea it is a good magazine.
It was Election Day so Jon had the day off but he would lost his address book and could not remember my number so he could not call.

Persons: [Chris Isham, Daniela Morera, Nima Farmanfarmian, Olivier Coquelin]
Text: Daniela Morera our Italian Interview correspondent came by the office with Olivier Coquelin who invited me to Haiti for the Nima Farmanfarmian-Chris Isham wedding in January. He owns that resort there. He should be interviewed for Popism-he is the one who owned Cheetah in the sixties the big discotheque on Broadway and 53rd. I do not want to talk long this morning I want to get over to Bloomingdale's before it is too crowded. [NOTE: Andy talks every morning in the past tense about the previous day's events; therefore when he speaks in the present tense or uses words like "now" or "today" he is referring to something happening right while he is talking or that he expects will happen on the day he is giving the diary. For example a Tuesday's diary would be given on a Wednesday morning so "last night" would mean Tuesday night "this afternoon" would mean Wednesday afternoon and "tomorrow" would mean Thursday.]

Persons: [Catherine Oxenberg, Chip Carter, Jean Michel Basquiat, Melvin Laird, Peter Max, Princess Elizabeth]
Text: -New York-Washington D.C. Election Day. It was the worst start imaginable. I was up at 7:00 ready at 8:00. I called Fred and he was just out of it. It drove me crazy. He was rambling. Maybe he would just slept for fifteen minutes I do not know. Anyway an hour later we were in Washington. Went to the Madison Hotel. Princess Elizabeth of Yugoslavia came with us. Her daughter Catherine Oxenberg starts on Dynasty next week and she was coming down later. And then some of the people went off to the White House but we were not invited so we stayed in our rooms. So we ordered lunch and that was expensive. Jean Michel Basquiat ordered a '66 Chateau Latour wine for $200 (lunch $500). Then we limoed to the Sequoia the presidential yacht and it was cold and miserable and getting dark. Same old people. Peter Max and his girlfriend who is so beautiful tall and Texan and I do not know why she is with him. She was at the beginning and ending of Heaven's Gate. A top model I forget her name. I talked to Chip Carter while I was there. Then we went back to the hotel and Jean Michel Basquiat rolled a joint. Then we ordered dinner which was disgusting (tip $5). Fred did not realize that he had only yellow socks and brown shoes so he could not wear his black suit. Entertainment Tonight got me on the way in and asked me who I voted for and I said "For the winner" and they said "who is that?" and I said "The winner is the winner." I do not even know what I meant. If they ever put all the clips they have ever gotten of me together they would see that I am a moron and finally stop asking me questions. I took pictures of Melvin Laird dancing. Jean Michel Basquiat was so hard to deal with he gets so paranoid. This was a "Non-partisan Party" that the Weismans were having because at the last election they gave a party for the Democrats and this time everybody was a Democrat but pretending to be a Republican.

Persons: [Barbara Allen, Georgia O'Keeffe, Juan Hamilton, Kay Larkin, Lily Auchincloss, Paul Jenkins, Robert Miller]
Text: It was Election Day so many places were closed. Catherine called and wanted to do something. We stayed at the office until 6:30 or 6:45 and then went up to 725 Fifth Avenue to the Robert Miller Gallery for Juan Hamilton's opening there (cab $4). And just when I got there a guy came in and served Juan papers. It was charges from the woman that used to work for Georgia O'Keeffe for years saying that he was conspiring to get all Georgia's paintings. I left Rupert on 66th and went home and glued. I would invited the Hoveydas out things are so bad in Iran and the du Pont girl and Paul Jenkins. And then Bob invited Lily Auchincloss-her husband Douglas just left her for Kay Kay Larkin. We went over to Quo Vadis. Hoveyda got a phone call and they told him that the phone lines from Iran to Paris and New York were out and the Shah's put the military out stronger. The Hoveydas looked worried. Then around the corner we saw Truman. He was fixing Barbara Allen up with a millionaire. I think it was actually his Jewish lawyer or something. And Truman is a completely different person from last week. Do you think they have found a new drug to give him? Really this week he is so dapper and last week he was an alcoholic.

Persons: [Chrissie Evert, Frank Gifford, Gerulaitis Margaret, Ken Norton, Lacey Neuhaus, Margaret Trudeau, Richard Weisman, Vitas Gerulaitis]
Text: Richard Weisman came down and he had just gotten back from the Ken Norton fight. He was in a nervous mood and when he saw that I was doing a new style of painting he got upset he did not like it that I did the Chrissie Evert in lots of little pictures instead of the big ones but then he saw that the Newsweek girl who was there interviewing me loved it so then he kept calling me back all day to say he was sorry. At Richard's party later for Vitas Gerulaitis Margaret Trudeau was there with two girlfriends from Canada. One was just divorced and she had three kids and she was fat and big and looked older than Margaret because she was fatter and she decided to put the make on me-she came over and put her hands on her hips and gave me the best lines I mean you really could fall for it! Nobody's ever said anything like it to me just the right thing something like: "You are so much more than I ever expected!" I told her that Margaret should go back to her husband and go into politics and she was thrilled to hear that that is what she thinks. She had a beautiful stole on in that deep purple color-"aubergine" is it? They always say it in the fashion shows and I never know what it is. Lacey Neuhaus was there with Francois de Menil and she said that she just met the number-one cowboy in the world and she was going to interview him for Interview. Frank Gifford was there with a woman maybe his girlfriend maybe his wife-she had so much makeup on lots of white all over her face and lots of eyeliner but very beautiful. He loved his painting. The owner of the Giants was there.
At the auction last night my Triple Elvis went for $135000 so that is good. It was estimated at $70000-$90000. But Thomas Ammann bid $440000 for one of David Whitney's Rauschenbergs.

Persons: [Bette Midler, Fran Lebowitz, Isabelle Adjani, Sophie Tucker]
Text: -Paris Club Sept invited us to a private dinner ($40 to chauffeur). We got there and our table was actually reserved for Bette Midler. Saw Isabelle Adjani so beautiful. Bette came in and got an ovation. She saw me and made me kiss her hand. Told her we just missed her in Copenhagen she said she knew all about it. I tried to talk to her but she reminds me too much of Fran Lebowitz-like she is afraid you will steal her material. We just do not hit it off. Valentino was there and he and Bette chatted she asked him how the shmatta trade was and what did Jackie O. buy and she wanted four of them and what was the new look. She gives everybody the Sophie Tucker answers. Then she left and the party kept going on.

Persons: [Barry Landau, Bob Weiner, Elton John, Jay Johnson, Jay Lane, Joe Dallesandro, Kenny Jay, Lester Persky, Michael Jackson, Nicky Weymouth, Peter Firth, Richard Burton, Steve Aronson, Steve Rubell, Tom Cashin]
Text: Cabbed up to Parke Bernet got a few catalogues because they seem to be the best reference books (cab $2 books $24). Ran into Kenny Jay Lane who is put his whole house and furnishings up for auction-now that he is getting divorced from Nicky Weymouth he can present it as something he is doing "for the settlement." When you see all his junk together it really looks bad. Went to Chembank ($4). Steve Aronson was at 860 looking around he had a beautiful girl with him. He says he can not start editing Popism until next week. Vincent was off in Montauk checking on the place-Jay Johnson and Tom Cashin are still out there roofing and repairing. By closing time Vincent still was not back so I locked the place up myself. And when it is my responsibility I get so nervous I do things like pull out the plugs to the Xerox machines so they will not start a spontaneous combustion; I decided I would risk leaving the refrigerator on. When I got home there was a message from Barry Landau somehow he would gotten my number. So now the three worst people to have your unlisted number have mine-Bob Weiner Steve Rubell and Barry Landau. Lester Persky called and invited me to a screening of Equus. I loved Peter Firth he was wonderful and Richard Burton was wonderful. The movie has the longest nudity. Usually when they photograph a cock they make it fall in the shadows and the shadows always fall where the cock is. But in this movie the cock always falls right where you can see it. Peter Firth's dick gets in the way when he moves. it is the biggest cock on screen and not circumcised. As big as Joe Dallesandro's. Peter Firth came over to me he would imported a girl from England for all the publicity and she was there and we had a good time. There was lots of food but I would already eaten. Then Peter Firth wanted to take the girl dancing so we walked over to Studio 54 for the Elton John thing. Stevie invited us all up to the booth where Michael Jackson was and Michael was sweet-in his high voice he asked me about art. David Hockney was there. The photographers were there and wanted Elton John and me to pose for pictures together so I asked Elton if I could kiss him but he did not answer me so I did not. Maybe he did not hear me. He was wearing a hat because of his hair transplant. In order to get out of Studio 54 alone I had to avoid all the boys I have been accepting rides and dates from lately. I had to look nervous and run around so no one would follow me-you know the "frantic" technique.

Persons: [Jean Michel Basquiat, Mayor Koch, Ronnie Cutrone]
Text: -Paris-New York When I got home to 66th Street I did not shower because I knew that if I did I would never get to work. I was wearing (laughs) "Essence of France"-b.o. There was a strange picture of Mayor Koch in the paper sneering at Nixon at the Cardinal Cooke funeral. It was a weird picture (cab $6). Met Lidija. Had a lot of coffee. Worked till 7:00 or 7:30. Ronnie Cutrone came by and said that he was in Milan when we were and that Jean Michel Basquiat went off to Madrid. Jean Michel Basquiat's trying to get so famous so fast and if it works he will have it I guess.

Persons: [Fran Lebowitz, Paloma Picasso, Perry Ellis, Thomas Ammann]
Text: It was a Paloma Picasso day. Went to breakfast at Tiffany's for her. The jewelry was pretty but I have the same stuff from the forties. it is copies of the forties. And Paloma did her little heart-shaped Elsa thing. It was expensive stuff-$27000 for a bracelet. After work I glued myself and went to Mr. Chow's for dinner for Paloma (cab $4). Saw Fran Lebowitz and told her she should go find a guy to have a hot love affair with because then if she ever has to write about one she will not be blank-a-roo. Perry Ellis looked really sexy with long hair. Everybody was somebody. Thomas Ammann was in town from Argentina he said it is so expensive there he does not know how anyone lives. He had a limo and I got home at 1:00.

Persons: [Alba Clemente, Diana Vreeland, Donna McKechnie, Elizabeth Ray, Frank Rich, George Washington, Lauren Hutton, Margaux Hemingway, Peter Beard, Rupert Everett, Steven Greenberg]
Text: Had a fight with Fred. he is getting more and more like Diana Vreeland every day. I say that Interview is a small magazine and he says no no it is not it is not. And he will not let me put my two cents in about it. I tell him "Fred Time is a 'large magazine.' They get $75000 a page. We get $3000." And he said "No no we get $3 100." I mean what is the difference? Paige said there was the opening of Nell's and that Steven Greenberg had a date with somebody she introduced him to and that he would take us all to Le Bernardin the expensive fish restaurant in the Equitable building. We went and it is so elegant so grand and the food is sort of ordinary but very expensive. My fish was cooked in sauerkraut so it was good just like eating a hot dog on the corner. Then we went with Steven to pick up Donna McKechnie who is back starring in Chorus Line. Steven knows all these same types of girls in their late thirties or forties who're on the prowl. Like Elizabeth Ray and Margaux Hemingway. Donna McKechnie was giving an interview to Frank Rich and she is actually beautiful but she is in a category that you can not do much with-forty-four and with a beautiful body but it is hard to find another show to dance in. She was kind of classy in a whorey way and she had a dress that was showing her nakedness. She was too grand for me but she was sweet. Then we went down to 14th Street to the opening of Nell's and that was really exciting. Rupert Everett came in with a costar of his. And Nell was sweet she said I would be the only one allowed to take pictures. But I did not want to move around really. Bianca was there and Lauren Hutton and Schnabel and everybody who'd ordinarily be at the Odeon. Paige went downstairs dancing with Benjamin and Schnabel and Alba Clemente and all those people. Peter Beard was there with his entourage. they will charge $5 admission. I do not know if those downtown kids will put it down because they are so used to freebies. Then we left and I feel funny when Steven takes us out because although he spends so much money on us I have the feeling in the back of my mind that he may be (laughs) a secret cheap person. You know? I have not figured out yet how he thinks. But he is always so generous to us. He dropped me off. And Steven and Nell both do the same thing-they carry a hairbrush and pull it out and brush their hair all the time. I guess Steven Greenberg's George Washington hair is his fortune his trademark.

Went to Sotheby's. it is so awful you see people pulling up the upholstery on chairs there and everything just ripping it up and you are allowed to to check to see things like if it is the original American wood all through it. it is so nutty. Then cabbed to meet Paige at the office ($5 newspapers $2 phone $1.50). And Paige and I had a big scene about these chocolates that this Neuchatel chocolate woman brought down. I mean Paige is just absolutely a weirdo. I had a talk with Fred and he says it is not good to be so involved with people from the office and maybe he is right because I see one side but then there is other sides. So this woman brings down all this chocolate and Paige has been telling her how much everyone there loves chocolate and Paige will not even have one piece! And I am saying "Paige have a piece" and she is shrieking and laughing hysterically and absolutely refusing and finally I ate lots of pieces but nobody else would. Here this woman's an advertiser and it is all these secret chocolate-eaters and they will not touch one piece! So finally I took all the chocolate upstairs and then Paige came and wanted some and I refused to give it to her. And I finally read a Xerox of Tama's story from The New Yorker and it was fun reading all about what life was like living with Ronnie-she calls him "Stash" in the story-and she made herself "Eleanor" and not a writer but a jewelry designer. And none of the people that I am with a lot now drink or anything. Wilfredo does not drink and Paige does not. And last night PH reminded me about how I used to put people down for not drinking that I would say "They think they are too good to drink" and it is true I did used to feel that way but when you do not drink yourself you sure see things differently.

Persons: [Alice Neel, Jackie Curtis, Jean Michel Basquiat, John Sex, Johnny Carson, Whoopi Goldberg]
Text: Jackie Curtis called and said that Alice Neel died. I would been meaning to call her for a while. She was a sweet old lady. I guess she was old enough though in her eighties I think. It seems like I just saw her on the Johnny Carson show. Jackie wants to take an ad in Interview for a play he is opening but how can we trust him to pay? Jean Michel Basquiat me John Sex and Fab Five Freddy cabbed uptown to the Lyceum and the Whoopi Goldberg show ($8). We were late and in the second row. Whoopi was great for one and a half hours just a blank stage but she held your interest. she is really intelligent and everything. She does a thing where she asks for quarters from the audience but then she did not give them back. So when it was over and we went back to see her she said that she usually gives them back-I asked her-but that a guy had given her a dollar bill and that threw her off and now she had about $4 and so she might just now give the money to a Catholic charity. She really liked Jean Michel Basquiat and I invited her to dinner but she said she had cramps or something.

Well I spent the evening with Dolly Parton. she is a Halston girl now she is on the arm of Halston. The Thurn und Taxis guy and Pierre de Malleray picked us up to go downtown to dinner at Ballato's. The Taxis guy got drunk and he told a lot of stories. he is the richest guy in Germany he is got a great body but his face is a little puffy he is old. He said some Negroes came up to him by his hotel and started to follow him with a baseball bat they were calling him a faggot and he turned around and said "Listen here you black niggers" something like that he told them off and they were so stunned that they went away. He said you have to fight back or you do not survive. We went to Halston's and Dolly was there wearing the most horrible dress a Halston that just looked awful. she is fat she likes to eat.

Woke up after a good long night's sleep. I needed it to clear up some pimples. When you do not sleep you really have them. Doug Christmas did not send a check yet and I told Fred to tell him I was not going to Paris unless we got it.
Jean Michel Basquiat came by and I slapped him in the face. (laughs) I am not kidding. Kind of hard. It shook him up a little. I told him "How dare you dump us in Milan!" Benjamin put me up to it.

This Retin-A stuff that is for curing acne is working but just on half my face. Half of my face is perfect and the other half is broken out all eruptions. It peels away your face. I went to a new beauty doctor and he gave me licorice root to take. I think maybe he just gives out things he wants to get rid of. And he is such a camp too. These quacks. The first time he took his fingers and touched my face he said "does not this feel tense?" and the second time he took his fingers and touched my face the same way and in the same place and he said "does not this feel relaxed?" Cab ($6) to B. Altman's dinner for the highfalutins. Ran into Sid and Anne Bass and into Ashton Hawkins. Got drunk and said terr-said funny-I was outrageous I guess. When I get drunk I get-outrageous. Then left at 11:00. Wanted to go see the Go-Go's but I was just so drunk.
Jean Michel Basquiat came over to the office to paint but he fell asleep on the floor. He looked like a bum lying there. But I woke him up and he did two masterpieces that were great.

Persons: [Bing Crosby, George Lois, John Curry, John Wayne, Sonny Liston, Steve McQueen]
Text: I ran into John Curry in the street but I did not recognize him when he said hi to me-not till three blocks later. So I decided to call and get tickets to go see him in Brigadoon. Oh I ran into a boy whose job is to go shopping for John and Yoko to buy them clothes and things. I asked him if they would ever made him bring anything back and he said just once. I asked him if they ever wore any of the clothes they bought since they do not go out and he said "they are going to make a comeback. they have been wearing them to the studio." Oh and the best thing he said was that when he started to work for them he had to sign a paper that said "I will not write a book about John Lennon and/or Yoko Ono." is not that great? He said he loves his job. I should find somebody to help me shop-show me where all the good new things are. Oh and I had a fight with the real estate guy. The building I wanted so badly on 22nd Street that I told him to keep me informed on he said went into contract on Friday. I was so mad. And then he told me that we had an appointment to look at the Con Ed building on 12th Street. And that is a great building but it is just too far downtown I can not face it. it is $1.5 plus it would be another million to fix up. We missed the opening of Brigadoon. John Curry was not great he was just adequate but he is a good actor. I just loved the show. The guy in front of us was from George Lois with a good Irish name maybe Callaghan he is the one I worked with when I did that Braniff commercial with Sonny Liston. And he told me the best sick joke. What are Bing Crosby and John Wayne getting for Christmas? Steve McQueen. Backstage I told John the show was so exciting and he said how I did not recognize him on the street and I explained that it was the hairdo that I recognized him three blocks later. I asked him to dinner but he said he was having dinner with friends.

Persons: [Alain Elkann, Bob Colacello, Diane Von Furstenberg, Ivory Coast, Jean Michel Basquiat, Marilyn Monroe, Sue Mengers]
Text: Diane Von Furstenberg was having a party for her boyfriend Alain Elkann who was married to the Agnelli daughter. he is French. he is written four books and in France if you are an intellectual you do not have to work they just treat you like this big-"intellectual." Like Loulou de la Falaise's husband who is supposed to be a novelist but I do not think he is ever finished anything. So Diane's going the Marilyn Monroe route of marrying one person for the name and now she is going with this guy who will write books about her. Worked. Fred decided to come along. Closed up fast. Went to the Carlyle ran into Sue Mengers in the elevator who'd been at the party she was with her same husband and she is thin and I do not know what she is doing. She lives here now. The cake was in the shape of a book. Bob Colacello was there. I read his article on Bianca in the new Vanity Fair. she is back big again the pictures of her walking with the Salvadorean children in the fields. Jean Michel Basquiat called back from the Ivory Coast. He said they sell meat with four million flies on it-they cut off a piece and just sell it with the flies. He sounded normal like he was off drugs and missing old times he wants to do prints together.

Persons: [Jean Michel Basquiat, Marvin Davis, Steve Rubell]
Text: Went to that restaurant Santa Fe (cab $5.50) and Bianca was on time. Then Calvin arrived with the interviewer from Playboy. Jean Michel Basquiat had his hand on Bianca's knee-she giggled. Then the greatest moment came when I went to pay the bill and Bianca said Calvin had paid. Bianca said she wanted to go to where they were shooting Rhinestone on West Broadway at one of the galleries. So we went down there and found Steve Rubell. Then Stallone came over. he is hot for Bianca I think he saw her and came right over. And I yapped about where was my role in Rhinestone that I would paid $5000 to get at some Marvin Davis charity auction out in Colorado. And they would turned this art gallery into a bar for the movie. You could see how much money they are spending. It was the first time I would been to a movie set where they would really turned something into something else completely. Zooms and booms all over the street. I thought the cab that was sitting behind me was part of the movie but then it turned out it was not so I got in and took it home ($6).

I broke something and realized I should break something once a week to remind me how fragile life is. It was a good plastic ring from the twenties. I walked on Madison and it was cold in the shade and warm in the sun. I had on the coat that Marina gave me which I love the Calvin Klein one with the hood but the pockets are not useful. they are so big but the way they are made everything slips out. Walked all the way down to the office and the sun was so bright in people's eyes that I did not get recognized a lot. Fred is coming back from L.A. And Craig Nelson called a few times I am hating him so much that I think I will take Christopher with me to some of the cities I have to do the book tour in just to drive Craig crazy. I read in "Suzy" about the Kluge party that I missed in Virginia everyone went to it. I just did not want to break my rut but boy I should have-it was every portrait I should ever be doing. And Paul Morrissey's movie Mixed Blood is still packing them in they say. We got the rights to Trash back from Cinema 5 and it is funny we have to go someplace and physically pick them up. And my big Mao painting is still lost somewhere in Europe they think Nice. it is Leo's fault. And Leo is getting as bad as Huntington Hartford-they say he just says yes to any girl who asks him for anything.

Persons: [Barry Diller, Barry McKinley, Georgia O'Keeffe, Heiner Bastion, Heiner Friedrich, Joseph Beuys, Juan Hamilton, Robert Hayes, Sally Kellerman, Steve Rubell]
Text: I ran into Juan Hamilton who was coming down to the office later. He and Georgia O'Keeffe are at the Mayfair (cab $3.50). As I got to the office Joseph Beuys the German artist was getting out of a car with his children and Heiner Bastion-about eight people. He kissed me on the mouth and I got nervous. I did not know what to talk to him about. Heiner Friedrich and Philippa de Menil came by. And Robert Hayes had Sally Kellerman and Barry Diller and Barry McKinley there and there was no room to sit down. And Heiner Bastion said I should photograph Beuys for a portrait. Then I was photographing Georgia and Juan in the back. it is too hard with famous people at the office all at the same time because nobody can understand why anybody else is there. I worked until 4:00 with Georgia. Finally they all left. Later I went to the horse show at Madison Square Garden. I went over with a bunch of horse people to the Statler Hilton for scrambled eggs and bacon I guess that is what horse people like to eat. It was good. I stole some silverware and then it was embarrassing because it fell out and everybody saw it. It was Statler Hilton silverware from the forties. At Studio 54 after that I ran into Steve Rubell who said that on Friday he was going to be sentenced to two months in jail that he would made a deal with the government-they would dropped the drug charges and he would pleaded guilty to income tax evasion. He asked if we would come and visit him.

Persons: [Janet Leigh, Jean Michel Basquiat, Tony Perkins, Van Johnson]
Text: Ferraro was on the news. I was liking her a lot in the beginning but now she is more like all the rest of them like mechanical. Jean Michel Basquiat was in bed with some new girl and did not show up. Bruno arrived and surprised us. And his wife-Yoyo. And they looked at the big paintings that Jean Michel Basquiat has been doing silkscreens on and they had a sour look they said it ruined his "intuitive primitivism." But he would always Xeroxed before and nobody knew it just looked like new drawings and put on with that stuff. Worked till 7:30. Then there was a party for Van Johnson at Limelight. When we got there he was leaving already. It was a party he was giving for Janet Leigh. And he was such a camp. He said "Oh I have been dying to meet you forever!" He seems like a big boozer. I guess there were not enough cute boys in there. Then in the middle of the room was a shower and a girl in it and blood all over and a guy like Tony Perkins in a grandmother's outfit. And in the middle of all this was the real Janet Leigh in a blue sequined dress.

Persons: [Lady Isabella Lambton, Madame Gres, Tim Leary]
Text: Lady Isabella Lambton Ann's sister is now answering the phones at the office while our receptionist Laura goes to Berlitz to finally learn English. After a benefit fashion show of Madame Gres went up to Diane de Beauvau's new showroom to see her first collection. I had to start lying immediately and tell her it was all great but especially after seeing all those beautiful Madame Gres and all the Halstons her stuff just looked so bad. She acts like a businesswoman-she does not take much coke in the day-but I do not know I think it is going to be a disaster. At dinner later at Quo Vadis Tim Leary was really sweet he talked some more for the tape about how Diane writing him those love letters and taking acid when she was fourteen got him in jail in Switzerland. He said the jails in Geneva can be like a good hotel-if you pay them they bring you pastries on a tray. And I can not believe it he remembers each time he ever saw me in the sixties and then in St. Moritz-what I was wearing everything-and I did not even know at the time that he would be noticing. Like when we went to his lecture and light-show things in the East Village. He said that if he had it to do all over again he wished he were with the Velvet Underground because they did so much and were really creative. I just think he is so intelligent. He probably really was with the CIA because he was the one at Harvard and now they are showing that the government was using LSD so far back and Tim was the master and when you are a master they do approach you. Diane de Beauvau and Pierre were on a couch arguing. She wanted him to think she was in love with Tim Leary and that they would had a romance so to do that she made a point of telling Pierre that there was absolutely nothing going on that she was not in love with Tim. So then he had to do the thing of caring because that was how she would be happy.

Persons: [Gaetana Enders, Governor Carey, Jean Michel Basquiat]
Text: There was a lunch and Gaetana Enders brought a politician from Venezuela and his wife. he is really good-looking he has a cane and his wife's beautiful. I would met him at Halston's years ago. They got away again though-he said that "maybe someday" he would "surprise her with a portrait." And then Governor Carey's wife-the Greek lady Evangeline-came and she came prepared for a free portrait. She was not wearing a hat like she always does and so I said "where is your hat?" and she said "None of your girls wear hats in their portraits."
